thread.title: Man Accused Of Shooting ‘Sick’ Dog Arrested For Animal Cruelty
thread.title_full: Man Accused Of Shooting ‘Sick’ Dog Arrested For Animal Cruelty

author: CBS Baltimore
title: Man Accused Of Shooting ‘Sick’ Dog Arrested For Animal Cruelty
text:
Man Accused Of Shooting ‘Sick’ Dog Arrested For Animal Cruelty March 29, 2017 12:25 PM Filed Under: Animal cruelty William Mitchell Harrell (Courtesy: Anne Arundel County PD) 
BALTIMORE (WJZ) — Police arrested a man who said he fatally shot his dog after it had been sick for several days after eating a foam pillow. 
William Mitchell Harrell faces charges of felony animal cruelty, discharging a firearm within a residential area, and reckless endangerment. 
The investigation into Harrell began after police got a call just before 12:30 p.m. on Tuesday, about shots fired in the 400 block of Master Derby Court in Annapolis. 
Responding officers met with Harrell, who said he shot his 2-year-old German Shepherd with his .25 caliber handgun after it had been sick for several days. 
He said he decided to put the dog down after it had not eaten or drank any water for days, and was having tremors and vomiting. He said the dog became sick after eating a foam pillow. 
After killing the dog, Harrel then started to bury it in his back yard. 
Animal control was called and recovered the dog’s remains.
